a.title: Alleghany County Public Schools is committed to continuous school improvement. With that being said, the results of our staff engagement, parent satisfaction, and student engagement surveys as well as the action plans for continuous improvement are linked here. Please review the results and contacts us should you have any questions.

br.a: Alleghany County Public Schools is committed to continuous school improvement. With that being said, the results of our staff engagement, parent satisfaction, and student engagement surveys as well as the action plans for continuous improvement are linked here. Please review the results and contacts us should you have any questions.

div.span: : ACPS offers after-hours Internet access to all students. Although home-based Internet access is not required for any homework assignment that is assigned by the division’s faculty, if a need exists, all students can take advantage of our free WiFi service. When parked within 150 feet of a school bus mounted hotspot, student-use Chromebooks will automatically connect and will be provided with a general but filtered Internet experience. High bandwidth activities such as gaming and video are not offered. The service is available Tuesdays through Fridays from 4:00 pm to 7:30 pm at Callaghan Elementary, Sharon Elementary, and Clifton Middle School. At Callaghan Elementary, please park in the parking lot near bus 49. At Sharon Elementary, please park near bus 24 and at Clifton Middle School, please park near bus 25. In support of visitor safety and to help us maintain the appearance of our buildings and grounds, please obey all posted speed limits, park only in designated parking spots and deposit all trash in available bins.

div.h2: Welcome to Alleghany County Public Schools

p.span: Alleghany County Public Schools (ACPS) values diversity in teaching and learning and works together to meet students where they are to support them in achieving their highest potential. ACPS provides a nurturing environment that incorporates 21st Century skills to develop life-long learners who are well-rounded citizens. ACPS also celebrates our successes.

span.span: Alleghany County Public Schools is committed to preparing all students to graduate. Students will:

li.span: Be well rounded and productive citizens;
Work collaboratively to accomplish team goals;
Demonstrate self-confidence in creative and constructive decision making; and

span.span: The Alleghany County School Board does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, political affiliation, gender, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, disability, or age in its programs and activities. The following have been designated as the contacts regarding compliance issues associated with this non-discrimination policy and compliance with Title IX: Fred Vaughan, Director of Human Resources and Pupil Personnel and Kelly Huff, Director of Secondary Instruction. For questions and compliance with Section 504 and ADA, contact Elizabeth Heath, Director of Special Education. Alleghany County School Board Office, 100 Central Circle/P.O. Drawer 140, Low Moor, Virginia 24457. 540-863-1800.

p.span: FOIA contact: Lorie Bess, Administrative Assistant to the Superintendent. Mrs. Bess may be reached by phone at (540) 863-1800 or by email at lbess@alleghany.k12.va.us

div.p: Alleghany County Public Schools has conformed to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0 Level AA.

br.span: Following these guidelines will make the ACPS web content accessible to a wider range of people with disabilities and more usable to users in general.
